q: , D-NY. The New York senator is a close friend of the congresswoman. On Wednesday night, she was in Gabrielle Giffords ' hospital room for the biggest milestone. Gabrielle Giffords opened her eyes. When her husband saw her making this effort he urged her and said Gabrielle Giffords open your eyes, open your eyes. And sure enough she did, said Kirsten Gillibrand .`` I was there when she was surrounded by her friends in the Congress and Senate. And I think it was a combination, perhaps, of the unexpected and the familiar that really

we joked about what we were going to do, she started to open her eyes, literally. She started to struggle,'' Debbie Wasserman Schultz told journalists aboard Air Force One as she accompanied Barack Obama back to Washington. It felt like we were watching a miracle.`` New York senator Kirsten Gillibrand said she and Debbie Wasserman Schultz were crying and when Gabrielle Giffords ' husband, Mark Kelly, a NASA astronaut, told his wife that if she could see them, she should give a thumbs up sign.`` Instead of giving us the thumbs up, she literally raises her whole arm, Kirsten Gillibrand said.Kelly has been ever present at his wife's side since the attack. Democrats countered that the law is already benefiting millions of Americans and should not be derailed. Because of the Affordable Care Act, Americans no longer have to live in fear that insurance companies will drop or cap their coverage if they get sick, or that they'll face double-digit premium increases with no accountability or recourse, Barack Obama said.`` Small businesses across the country can take advantage of a new health care tax credit to offer coverage to their employees, and children suffering from an illness or pre-existing condition can no longer be denied
